results.title: Show me English: the appointment [episode 1]
results.creator_credit: Graeme Rowland, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Tina makes arrangements to visit her son’s teacher to discuss his progress. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Accounting equation. Parts 1-4
results.creator_credit: Niels Ellmoos, Bill Renwick and Interaction Media
results.brief_description: A four part instructional series following a ‘real-life’ business entity in Newcastle, Australia, through one month’s trading, to the presentation of financial statements.

results.title: Extinction is forever!
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Kerry Aulsbrook, an Education Officer specializing in natural history at the Museum of Victoria introduces Australian customs regulations prohibiting imports of animals and natural products. Examines the threats faced by species now close to extinction because of human interference.

results.title: Get wet again
results.brief_description: More fun with Jonathan Coleman. In this program his nervous “brother” Terry learns to swim - with the assistance of Lisa Forrest. The emphasis is on feeling at ease in the water and includes activities such as blowing bubbles, floating, basic swimming and rescue.

results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Tony Paice and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A program that discusses and illustrates student participation which is seen as part of the broader decision-making partnership among teachers, students, parents, principals and administrators from school to state level.

results.title: Local traffic: a suburban dilemma
results.brief_description: Sandringham is a suburb where through traffic is causing problems in local streets. The program follows the process whereby residents press their local council to take action on the problem. A firm of consultants is appointed and we see the following five stages at work: the study, the proposal, the survey, the debate and the outcome.

results.title: History of Australian surfing
results.creator_credit: Nat Young, Grant Young and Nat Young Holdings
results.brief_description: This program reminisces over the colourful sixties, when surfing was the latest fashion - bikinis, okanuis, malibus, the Delltones, Little Patty, the stomp! Performances from many of Australia’s surfing champions are presented, including Wayne Lynch, Michael Patterson, Peter Townsend, Mark Warren, Mark Richards, Simon Anderson and Rabbit Bartholomew.

results.title: Green and gold greats
results.brief_description: This program brings together a fifty year span of Australian sporting splendour including performances of Don Bradman, Dawn Fraser, Heather McKay, Walter Lindrum, Majorie Jackson, Betty Cuthbert, Herb Helliot, Peter Thomson, Les Darcy, Vic Patrick, Merwyn Wood, Lew Hoad, Ken Rosewall and Phar Lap.

results.title: Cornflakes for tea
results.creator_credit: John Colquhoun, Tom Broadbridge and Andromeda Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatization of how a family living in high-rise inner city flats manage to cope with caring for each other when first their mother and then their father abandon them. Provides many points which could act as stimulus for discussion including perspectives on family relationships, contrasts on single parent and conventional nuclear families, welfare workers and their role, supportive community members, and the warm relationship of the central characters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Colquhoun, Tom Broadbridge and Andromeda Productions

results.title: Issues in education: the Victorian Certificate of Education
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A panel of educationalists, including two members of the Ministerial Committee for Review of Post-Compulsory Schooling, overview the new Victorian Certificate of Education and current issues in education.
